The Apostle amplifies his ininistry by a twofold argu- ment: l. By his great labour, which he intimates under the words labouring and striving. 2. By the effectual as· sistance of Christ, which he expresses in adding, according to his working, which workctlz z'n me mightily. He employs both these arguments for confirming the Colossians in the doctrine of the Gospel. For if Paul propagated this doc- trine with all diligence, it ought also to bind the Colossians with equal constancy : If Christ promoted this doctrine by Divine aid, the Colossians ought to adopt the same as the word of God.
